messages.content:
You are a debugging assistant. You will be presented with a failing test, and tools (functions) to access the source code of the system under test (SUT). Your task is to provide a step-by-step explanation of how the bug occurred, based on the failing test and the information you retrieved using tests about the SUT. You will be given 9 chances to interact with functions to gather relevant information. An example answer would look like follows.

Title: Diagnosis of test `testGenerateURLFragment`
Details: The test `testGenerateURLFragment` checks whether HTML entities such as `"` are correctly escaped to their corresponding character by the `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` method. However, the test failure indicates that this is not the case. Following the execution path, we find that `StandardToolTipTagFragmentGenerator.generateToolTipFragment` is not escaping any HTML code; instead, it is using its input `toolTipText` as is. Consequently, un-escaped strings are being returned, which leads to the error demonstrated by the test.

After providing this diagnosis, you will be prompted to suggest which methods would be the best locations to be fixed. The answers should be in the form of `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` without commentary (one per line), as your answer will be automatically processed before finally being presented to the user.

The test `['org.jfree.data.time.junit.TimeSeriesTests.testBug1832432()']` failed.
The test looks like:

```java
615 :     public void testBug1832432() {
616 :         TimeSeries s1 = new TimeSeries("Series");
617 :         TimeSeries s2 = null;
618 :         try {
619 :             s2 = (TimeSeries) s1.clone(); // error occurred here
620 :         }
621 :         catch (CloneNotSupportedException e) {
622 :             e.printStackTrace();
623 :         }
631 :     }
```

It failed with the following error message and call stack:

```
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Requires start <= end.
	at org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries.createCopy(TimeSeries.java:880)
	at org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries.clone(TimeSeries.java:857)
	at org.jfree.data.time.junit.TimeSeriesTests.testBug1832432(TimeSeriesTests.java:619)
seriesA = org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries@d3604465
seriesB = org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries@9e7d5570
seriesC = org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries@58c0b535
gotSeriesChangeEvent = false
class$org$jfree$data$time$junit$TimeSeriesTests = class org.jfree.data.time.junit.TimeSeriesTests
class$org$jfree$data$time$Year = class org.jfree.data.time.Year
class$org$jfree$data$time$Day = null
class$org$jfree$data$time$Month = null
class$org$jfree$data$time$FixedMillisecond = null
s1 = org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries@bb9d8ed6
s2 = null
```

Start by calling the `get_failing_tests_covered_classes` function.

The failing test `TimeSeriesTests.testBug1832432` covers classes from the `org.jfree.data.general` and `org.jfree.data.time` packages. Next, I will retrieve the methods covered by this test in the `TimeSeries` class. Let's fetch the covered methods.

messages.name: get_failing_tests_covered_methods_for_class
messages.content: [".createCopy(int, int)", ".clone()", ".TimeSeries(java.lang.Comparable)", ".add(org.jfree.data.time.RegularTimePeriod, java.lang.Number)", ".add(org.jfree.data.time.RegularTimePeriod, java.lang.Number, boolean)", ".TimeSeries(java.lang.Comparable, java.lang.Class)", ".getDataItem(int)", ".getTimePeriod(int)", ".add(org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeriesDataItem, boolean)", ".removeAgedItems(boolean)", ".getItemCount()", ".TimeSeries(java.lang.Comparable, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.Class)"]

The failing test covers several methods in the `TimeSeries` class, including the `.clone()` method. The test failure occurred at line 619 where the `.clone()` method was called. The error message indicates an `IllegalArgumentException` with the message "Requires start <= end" in the `TimeSeries.createCopy` method. 

Next, I will retrieve the code snippet for the `TimeSeries.createCopy` method to understand the cause of the issue.

messages.name: get_code_snippet

messages.content:
The `TimeSeries.createCopy` method checks if the `end` parameter is less than the `start` parameter and throws an `IllegalArgumentException` with the message "Requires start <= end" in this case. This is where the error occurred due to violating this condition. The `clone()` method is calling `createCopy` internally, and the error arises from this violation.

To fix the issue, the `end` parameter passed to the `createCopy` method needs to be greater than or equal to the `start` parameter.
Based on the cause of the issue identified, the best location to fix the problem would be:
```
org.jfree.data.time.TimeSeries.createCopy(int, int)
```

Based on the available information, provide the signatures of the most likely culprit methods for the bug. Your answer will be processed automatically, so make sure to only answer with the accurate signatures of all likely culprits (in `ClassName.MethodName(ArgType1, ArgType2, ...)` format), without commentary (one per line).
